title: Magic and Synchronicity
body:
Magic and Synchronicity are phenomena spoken about loosely and with much criticism among most. This episode explores these topics as forms of science yet to be explained but just as tangible as any other.

Magic is defined by some as trickery or diversion of attention to hide a simpler explanation behind the illusion of the impossible.  Synchronicity is a Jungian psychological term coined to explain when events and phenomena seems to organize themselves automatically without any conventionally agreed upon human intervention.  Attending Burning Man 2013, Ben Stewart takes the viewer through his experience of these topics and shows just how simple and subtle they appear in everyday life and how to apply them.
teaser: Magic and Synchronicity are phenomena spoken about loosely and with much criticism among most. This episode explores these topics as forms of science yet to be explained but just as tangible as any other.

title: Conspiracy and Virality
body:
The worldwide web is a phenomenon so new to humanity, there is no historical reference to understand its effects.  Now with websites such as Youtube and Google Videos and a wave of free internet documentaries regarding conspiracy and critical analysis of all forms of governance, the world is experiencing a renaissance of thought.  

Host Ben Stewart interviews Dylan Avery, creator of the first free internet blockbuster conspiracy documentary regarding the events on September 11thin NYC, and explores his experience of how one simple film project release for free online lit a fire that has been raging in the minds of millions ever since.
teaser: Conspiracy and Virality centers around Dylan Avery, creator of Loose Change.  The history of the internet and how viral conspiracy videos awoke a new paradigm of critical thinking is the focus.

title: Relationship and Movement
body:
Host Ben Stewart traveled to California after Burning Man to visit Foster and Kimberly Gamble, most notable for their internet documentary Thrive.  The interview is out of the box for Foster and Kim as Ben strays from the conventional questions and dives into the heart of where their vision and intentions lie.  

The topic of their relationship with one another was the cornerstone.  The love they share with one another, compassion, open mindedness and gentle approach towards each other has become the source from which all their ideals and visions of social change come from.  This episode explores the simplest yet most unexplainable forces in human existence: Love and Change.
teaser: Foster and Kimberly Gamble of the Thrive film and Movement are interviewed by Host Ben Stewart to explore the root cause and foundation their social movement is built upon. Love is the rabbit hole we found.

title: Medicintegrity
body:
Sergey Baranov is a medicine worker in the Andes Mountains and Sacred Valley of Peru.  Host Ben Stewart traveled into the ancient Inca territory to drink Huachuma, a sacred hallucinogenic cactus traditionally drunk in ceremonies and rituals.  

Sergey recites his journey in life that brought him to the plant medicine, Peru and being an author.  The whole tale revolves around challenges to test his integrity with administering the plant for others and becoming a true Huachumero, keeper of the gateway between this world and the invisible.
teaser: Sergey Baranov is a medicine worker in the Andes as well as author of the book Path.  Host Ben Stewart takes a sacred cacti medicine and explores the integrity of this Huachumero in all his worldly endeavors.
